citation.article-title: Dechloromonas agitata gen. nov., sp. nov. and Dechlorosoma suillum gen. nov., sp. nov., two novel environmentally dominant (per)chlorate-reducing bacteria and their phylogenetic position.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Dechlorosoma (De.chlo.ro.so'ma. L. pref. de from; Gr. adj. chloros green (chlorine) ; Gr. neut. n. soma body; N.L. neut. n. Dechlorosoma dechlorinating body)
Cells are Gram-negative, facultative anaerobic, nonspore-forming, non-fermentative rods, 1.0x0.3 μm.
Cells are motile by a single polar flagellum and occur singly or in chains.
Simple organic fatty acids are used as electron donors with O2, ClO-3 , ClO-4 or NO-3 as alternative electron acceptors.
Organic electron donors are completely oxidized and perchlorate or chlorate are completely reduced to chloride.
